content: JioPay offers digital payment acceptance solutions for businesses, providing a safe, smart, and quick way to accept payments. Key products include Payment Gateway, Point of Sale (POS), UPI Hub, Biller Center, and a Business App. JioPay supports various payment methods and offers features like online payment collection, in-store payments, UPI payments, bill payments, and business management tools. JioPay is committed to technology, security, reliability, and compliance.

llm_info.heading: Introduction to JioPay Business and Services

content: JioPay provides multiple features and optimizations to keep businesses ahead of the curve. The platform is designed for security, reliability, and scalability, reducing operational expenses. JioPay adheres to the highest compliance standards. Integration with multiple institutions ensures high success rates and uptime. JioPay offers versatile solutions for various payment needs.

llm_info.heading: JioPay Business Features and Benefits

content: Jio Payment Solutions Limited (formerly Reliance Payment Solutions Limited) is the entity behind JioPay Business. The registered address is in Mumbai, Maharashtra, India, and the corporate address is in Navi Mumbai, India. The document also provides links to various legal and support resources, including Privacy Policy, Terms & Conditions, Grievance Redressal Policy, and Merchant Onboarding & KYC-AML Policy.

llm_info.heading: JioPay Business Contact and Legal Information

content: Jio Payment Solutions Limited (JPSL) facilitates a fast and frictionless signup process for merchants. Merchants must provide and update their basic details. JPSL complies with the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002, RBI regulations, and KYC guidelines. The policy reflects a zero-tolerance approach to associated risks. The onboarding journey includes account activation and periodic updates.

llm_info.heading: Merchant Onboarding Overview and KYC Compliance

content: Merchants can start their registration by downloading and signing up with the JPSL Merchant Acquisition Form. Existing merchants expanding JioPay integration can use the JPSL Merchant Acquisition Form (Supplementary). For more details, contact merchant.support@jiopay.in. The onboarding process continues beyond account activation with periodic updates and due diligence.

llm_info.heading: Merchant Onboarding Process and Registration Options

content: JioPay may not offer payment processing services to restricted businesses. Merchants should check if their business is on the restricted list. Click the provided link to view detailed information on restricted businesses. After verifying the business is not restricted, merchants must complete the online signup process and upload KYC documents. Links to document lists and declaration forms are provided.

llm_info.heading: Restricted Businesses and Document Submission for Onboarding

content: Merchants need to upload KYC documents to complete their registration. The document provides links to the List of Documents for Sole Proprietorship and Entity Annexure. It also provides links to download the following forms: ANX-A (Declaration when owner/business name is not on proof of business), ANX-B (Declaration for Date of Birth mismatch), and ANX-C (Declaration for GST unavailable).

llm_info.heading: KYC Document and Declaration Forms

content: JioPay Business offers digital payment solutions. This document outlines the Terms and Conditions for BillPay services, specifically for Agents. These terms constitute a legal agreement between the Agent and Jio Payment Solutions Limited (Agent Institution) for using the Platform. The Agent's access to the Platform signifies acceptance of these Terms. The Agent Institution reserves the right to modify these Terms at any time.

llm_info.heading: Introduction to JioPay Business and BillPay Terms & Conditions

content: This section defines key terms used throughout the BillPay Terms and Conditions. Key definitions include: Affiliate, Agent (customer touchpoints), Agent Institution, Applicable Laws, BBPCU (Bharat BillPay Central Unit), BBPOU (Bharat BillPay Operating Unit), BBPS (Bharat Bill Payment System), Billers, Bill Payment Services, Customer, KYC Information, Platform, Privacy Policy, RBI, RBI Guidelines, and Terms.

llm_info.heading: Definitions: Key Terms in JioPay BillPay

content: Agents are responsible for providing customer touchpoints for bill payments within the BBPS. They facilitate BBPS registration, assist customers with biller mapping, and provide necessary hardware and software. Agents must offer multiple payment modes, adhere to BBPS guidelines, and inform customers about service charges (maximum Rs. 25) and settlement cycles. They must also provide instant payment confirmation.

llm_info.heading: Roles and Responsibilities of JioPay BillPay Agents

content: Agents must prominently display the BBPS logo and important terms and conditions in multiple languages. They must ensure confidentiality, not misuse customer data, and verify data accuracy. Agents should handle customer disputes sensitively and share payment receipts digitally or via print. Agents must also inform customers about complaint resolution processes.

llm_info.heading: Agent Compliance and Customer Interaction Guidelines

content: Non-compliance with guidelines can result in penalties. Agents may be terminated if customer dispute percentages exceed thresholds. Agents must ensure transaction security and adhere to transaction flow standards. In case of connection errors or transaction failures, the Agent must notify the Agent Institution/BBPOU and refund the customer via the Agent Source Account (VPA).

llm_info.heading: Agent Penalties, Transaction Errors, and Refund Procedures

content: Agents are subject to annual internal audits by RBI, BBPCU, BBPOU, or Agent Institution. Upon termination, Agents must cease using BBPS names, logos, and trademarks. Unauthorized use can lead to legal action. Agents must inform the Agent Institution of inquiries from authorities. Agents must maintain records for inspection and submit required reports.

llm_info.heading: Audits, Intellectual Property, and Publicity Restrictions for Agents

content: Agents are liable for fraudulent activities, wilful or negligent acts. Agents must indemnify the Agent Institution and BBPS against claims, losses, and expenses arising from their actions or omissions, including legal costs. Agents are responsible for obtaining necessary statutory or regulatory approvals.

llm_info.heading: Agent Indemnification and Liability

content: Agent membership in BBPS can be terminated under various circumstances, including license cancellation, inability to conduct business, insolvency, failure to meet qualification criteria, breach of regulatory guidelines, breach of terms, or exceeding customer dispute thresholds.

llm_info.heading: Termination of Agent Membership in BBPS

content: Upon termination, all rights and obligations cease, except for accrued rights. Agents must stop using BBPOU and BBPS names, logos, and trademarks and remove them from all display locations.

llm_info.heading: Consequences of Agent Termination

content: Agents must maintain confidentiality. Agent Institution may share KYC details with BBPOU, BBPCU, or third parties for Bill Payment Services. Disputes are to be settled amicably, failing which, arbitration in Mumbai, India, will be the method of resolution. The Payment and Settlement Systems Act, 2007, governs disputes covered by its provisions.

llm_info.heading: Confidentiality, Data Sharing, and Dispute Resolution

content: These Terms and Conditions are governed by the laws of India. The courts in Mumbai have exclusive jurisdiction over any disputes arising from the use of BBPS. Agents consent to the personal jurisdiction of these courts.

llm_info.heading: Governing Law and Jurisdiction

content: JioPay Business is a payment aggregator and gateway provided by Jio Payment Solutions Limited (formerly known as Reliance Payment Solutions Limited), a subsidiary of Reliance Industries Limited. It is designed to help merchants and businesses of all sizes accept and process payments online and offline. This includes support for web, mobile, and Point of Sale (POS) systems. JioPay Business aims to streamline payment operations and provide a seamless payment experience for customers.

llm_info.heading: Introduction to JioPay Business

content: The JioPay Business App is designed for retailers, business owners, and service providers to manage payments efficiently, even while mobile. It provides a comprehensive platform for payment processing activities. Key features include accepting payments, viewing past transactions, issuing refunds, and managing your profile. This app streamlines financial operations, offering convenience and control for business users.

llm_info.heading: Introduction to the JioPay Business App

content:
To download the JioPay Business App, follow these steps:

1.  Open the Google Play Store app on your phone.
2.  Search for "JioPay Business" and select it.
3.  Tap "Install" to download and install the app.

llm_info.heading: Downloading the JioPay Business App

content: If you have forgotten your JioPay Business account password, you can easily reset it. During the login process on either the JioPay Business App or the Dashboard, locate and select the 'Forgot password' option. Following this, carefully adhere to the on-screen instructions provided to successfully reset your password. This process ensures secure access to your account.

llm_info.heading: Password Reset for JioPay Business Account

content:
If you are experiencing difficulties logging into the JioPay Business App or Dashboard, please follow these troubleshooting steps:

1.  **Check your internet connection:** Verify that you have a stable internet connection. Try switching between Wi-Fi and mobile data to ensure connectivity.
2.  **Reinstall the app:** Uninstall the JioPay Business App from your device and then reinstall it. This ensures you have the most up-to-date version.
3.  **Verify your credentials:** Double-check that you are entering the correct username and password. If you've forgotten your password, use the 'Forgot Password' option to reset it.

llm_info.heading: Troubleshooting Login Issues for JioPay Business App/Dashboard

content: If the JioPay Business App is crashing on your phone, follow these troubleshooting steps to resolve the issue. First, verify your internet connection. Ensure you have a stable internet connection by switching between Wi-Fi and mobile data. If the issue persists, try deleting and reinstalling the app. Uninstall the JioPay Business App and reinstall it to get the latest version. Finally, check for phone software updates. Make sure your phone's software is up to date by checking for available updates in your phone's settings.

llm_info.heading: Troubleshooting: JioPay Business App Crashing

content: To view transaction details within the JioPay application or portal, follow these steps: Locate and click the icon situated in the top right corner of the App/Portal interface. From the options presented, select 'Transactions'. This action will display a comprehensive list of your transaction details, allowing you to review past payments and activities. This feature provides a convenient way to monitor your financial transactions within the JioPay ecosystem.

llm_info.heading: Viewing Transaction Details in JioPay App/Portal

content: The JioPay Business Dashboard is a user interface designed specifically for merchants to configure and manage their JioPay Business accounts. It serves as a centralized platform for all aspects of business and payment management. The dashboard provides real-time charts and analytics, allowing merchants to track their business performance effectively. Key features include detailed reports, transaction history monitoring, and payment trend analysis. This user-friendly interface empowers merchants to make informed decisions, optimize payment processes, and gain better control over their operations, ultimately driving business growth.

llm_info.heading: Introduction to JioPay Business Dashboard

content: To generate reports on your JioPay business Dashboard, you can export all transaction, refund, and settlement data. These reports are available in Excel and Text formats. You can access and download reports from the 'Reports' section of the Dashboard. Reports can be generated for daily, monthly, or custom date ranges, providing flexibility in data analysis and reconciliation. This feature allows you to track your financial activity efficiently.

llm_info.heading: Generating Transaction Reports on the JioPay Business Dashboard

content: This document explains how to create Collect links within the JioPay system. Collect links allow you to request payments from customers. There are two primary methods for creating Collect links: using the JioPay Business API or through the JioPay Dashboard. The choice depends on your technical capabilities and preferences. The following sections detail each method.

llm_info.heading: Creating Collect Links: Overview and Methods

content: If you possess programming knowledge or have developer access, you can generate Collect links programmatically using the JioPay Business API. This method offers greater flexibility and automation capabilities. We provide an integration kit to assist with the API integration process. Please refer to the API documentation for detailed instructions and code samples. Contact support for the integration kit.

llm_info.heading: Creating Collect Links via API

content:
To create a Collect link using the JioPay Dashboard, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to the JioPay Dashboard.
2.  Navigate to the Payment Links section.
3.  Click on the 'Create Payment Link' button.
4.  Enter the payment amount and customer details.

Once created, the payment link will be automatically shared with the customer via SMS and email.

llm_info.heading: Creating Collect Links via the JioPay Dashboard

content: The payment modes available via a Collect link include Cards, Net banking, Wallets, and UPI. The specific payment methods available to a customer when using a Collect link depend on the activated payment methods configured for the Merchant ID (MID). This means that the options a customer sees will vary based on the merchant's setup within JioPay. For example, a merchant might choose to only accept card payments and UPI, in which case, those would be the only options presented to the customer. Always check the merchant's specific configuration.

llm_info.heading: Payment Modes Available via Collect Link

content: You cannot use a single Collect link to accept payments from multiple customers. A Collect link is designed for a specific transaction and is intended for use by a single customer to make a payment. If you need to accept payments from multiple customers, you must generate separate Collect links for each customer. This ensures proper transaction tracking and reconciliation within the JioPay system.

llm_info.heading: Single Collect Link Usage Limitation

content: The default validity period for a Collect link is 90 days. Merchants have the flexibility to customize the validity period. To do so, they must uncheck the default expiry checkbox and then select their desired validity period. The maximum validity allowed is 180 days, while the minimum validity can be set to any duration based on the merchant's specific requirements.

llm_info.heading: Collect Link Validity and Customization

content: Currently, JioPay does not support the creation of bulk Collect links. This feature is not available at this time. However, the development team is actively working on implementing this functionality. It is anticipated that bulk Collect link creation will be available in the near future. Please check back for updates or refer to the JioPay help center for announcements regarding new features and services.

llm_info.heading: Bulk Collect Link Availability

content: Currently, partial payments are not supported when using JioPay Collect links. Customers are required to pay the exact amount specified in the Collect link.  The system does not allow for payments less than the total amount requested.  Please note that this functionality is under development and is expected to be available in the future. We are actively working on enabling partial payment options for Collect links to provide greater flexibility to our customers.

llm_info.heading: Partial Payments with Collect Links

content: When using a Collect link in JioPay, customers are restricted from entering the payment amount. The customer can only make a payment for the exact amount specified within the generated Collect link. This feature ensures the payment is for the intended transaction and prevents accidental or unauthorized modifications to the payment amount. This is a security measure to maintain payment accuracy and control.

llm_info.heading: Collect Link Payment Amount Restrictions

content:
You can add sub-users to your JioPay Business account. This allows you to manage access and permissions within your organization. To add a sub-user, follow these steps:

*   Go to the "Settings" tab in the merchant dashboard.
*   Click on "User Management" and provide the necessary details for the new user.
*   Grant appropriate permissions based on their requirements.
*   Click "Add User" to complete the process.
*   The new sub-user will receive an invitation to create a password by clicking on the "Forgot Password" option on the login page.

llm_info.heading: Adding Sub-Users to JioPay Business Accounts

content: To enable a new sub-user to access the merchant dashboard, the sub-user must first create a password. This is achieved by clicking the 'Forgot Password' link on the JioPay login page. After clicking this link, the sub-user will be prompted to set a new password. Once the new password is created, the sub-user can then log in to the JioPay platform using their new password on the standard JioPay login page. This process ensures secure access for all sub-users.

llm_info.heading: Sub-User Access to Merchant Dashboard

content: As a JioPay business customer, you have the ability to manage your sub-users. This includes the ability to block, edit, and delete them. To access these management features, navigate to the 'User Management' section within the 'Settings' tab of your JioPay business account. This allows you to control access and permissions for your sub-users effectively.

llm_info.heading: Managing Sub-Users: Blocking, Editing, and Deleting

content: Repeat is a billing system designed for recurring payments. It allows consumers to make automated and regular payments for services they use. This system is ideal for ongoing services and subscriptions, providing a seamless payment experience for your customers. By using Repeat, you can streamline your billing process and securely collect payments on a recurring basis. This ensures consistent revenue and reduces manual billing efforts.

llm_info.heading: Introduction to Repeat: Recurring Billing System

content: JioPay supports two primary payment methods for repeat payments: Cards and UPI. This allows customers to easily set up recurring payments for their subscriptions using their preferred payment options. Both cards and UPI offer a secure and convenient way to manage repeat transactions.

llm_info.heading: Supported Payment Methods for Repeat Payments

content: As per the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) guidelines, JioPay allows debiting a customer without two-factor authentication (2FA) for subsequent payments up to a maximum amount of ₹15,000/-. This applies to recurring transactions where the customer has previously authenticated a payment. Please note that this amount is subject to change based on updates to RBI regulations. It is crucial to stay informed about the latest RBI guidelines to ensure compliance.

llm_info.heading: Maximum Debit Amount Without 2FA for Subsequent Payments

content: To offer your customers a free trial using JioPay, you have two mandate registration options. The first is Standalone, where a nominal amount, such as ₹2, is deducted from the customer and then refunded. This allows you to initiate debits after the trial period. The second option is Inline, where the customer is charged immediately, and the subscription begins right away. This allows for immediate access to the service or product being offered.

llm_info.heading: Offering Free Trials to Customers in JioPay

content: Can I create Repeat payments via the JioPay dashboard? No, currently the creation of Repeat payments is not supported through the dashboard interface. Repeat payments can only be initiated using the on-demand API. This means you will need to integrate with the JioPay API to set up recurring payments for your customers. Refer to the API documentation for detailed instructions on implementing repeat payment functionality.

llm_info.heading: Repeat Payment Creation via Dashboard

content: JioPay Business provides on-demand APIs to manage your subscription plans. You are responsible for managing your subscription plans using these APIs. The APIs offer the functionality to create, manage, and handle subscriptions for your customers. This includes setting up recurring payments, modifying subscription details, and handling cancellations. Detailed API documentation is available on the JioPay Business portal to guide you through the integration process. Please refer to the API documentation for specific instructions and code examples to implement subscription management within your application.

llm_info.heading: Subscription Management with JioPay Business APIs

content:
To create a marketing campaign using the JioPay dashboard, follow these steps:

1.  **Login:** Access the JioPay dashboard using your business credentials.
2.  **Navigate to Campaigns:** Locate the 'Campaigns' section within the menu, typically found on the left side of the dashboard interface.
3.  **Create Campaign:** Click the 'Create Campaign' button. This will initiate the campaign setup process.
4.  **Configure Campaign:** Customize the campaign settings to align with your specific business objectives and requirements. This may include setting the campaign name, target audience, budget, and other relevant parameters.
5.  **Publish Campaign:** After configuring the campaign, click the 'Publish Now' button to activate it and make it live for your customers.

llm_info.heading: Creating a Campaign in JioPay Dashboard

content:
To edit an existing campaign within the JioPay dashboard, follow these straightforward steps:

1.  Navigate to the 'Campaigns' section within the JioPay dashboard interface.
2.  Identify and select the specific 'Campaign ID' corresponding to the campaign you intend to modify.
3.  Within the offer configuration settings, make the necessary adjustments and changes to the campaign parameters.
4.  Once the modifications are complete, save the changes to ensure they are applied.
5.  The campaign will be automatically updated and republished with the newly configured settings, reflecting your edits.

llm_info.heading: Editing a Campaign in the JioPay Dashboard

content:
To pause or stop a campaign within the JioPay dashboard, follow these steps:

*   Navigate to the 'Campaigns' section in the JioPay dashboard.
*   Select the specific Campaign ID you intend to manage.
*   Choose the appropriate action: pause or stop, based on your business needs.
*   Pausing a campaign allows for re-enabling it later, provided it hasn't expired.
*   Stopping a campaign is a permanent action and cannot be reversed.
*   The campaign will be updated and the changes published.

llm_info.heading: Pausing or Stopping a JioPay Campaign

content: Settlement is the process by which you receive funds in your bank account for payments collected from your customers for your products or services using JioPay Business. This process ensures that the money your customers pay is transferred to your designated bank account. The settlement frequency, or how often you receive these funds, is determined by the specific agreement you have with JioPay Business. Please refer to your contract for the exact settlement schedule.

llm_info.heading: Understanding Settlements in JioPay Business

content: Settlements are generally processed on a T+1* working day basis. 'T' represents the date on which the payment from your customer was captured. This means that the funds collected on a particular day (T) will typically be credited to your bank account on the next working day (T+1). Please note that the exact settlement frequency may vary based on your specific agreement with JioPay Business. Weekends and public holidays may affect the processing time. Please consult your agreement for details.

llm_info.heading: Settlement Frequency and Processing Time

content: To check settlements in your bank account, you can utilize the Unique Transaction Reference (UTR) number provided by our banking partner for each settlement. This UTR number is crucial for tracking your funds. You can find the UTR by either clicking on the specific settlement ID within the JioPay platform or by downloading the comprehensive settlement report. Once you have the UTR, you can use it to easily track the settlement status within your bank account. This allows for efficient reconciliation and monitoring of your transactions.

llm_info.heading: Checking JioPay Settlements in Your Bank Account

content:
If you are not receiving your settlements, the standard settlement cycle is T+1 working days (T being the date of payment capture). To investigate a delayed settlement, please follow these steps:

1.  Log in to the JioPay Business App or Dashboard and navigate to the 'My Profile' section.
2.  Verify that the settlement information displayed in your profile matches the bank account you are expecting the funds to be credited to.
3.  Check your bank account for any credit transactions from 'JioPay', 'JPSL', or 'Reliance Payment Solutions'. Your funds are secure.

If you still haven't received your settlement within two days, please contact JioPay Business Merchant support.

llm_info.heading: Troubleshooting Delayed Settlements

content: If the settlement information in your JioPay Business profile is incorrect, you need to update it. To do so, send a request to merchant.support@jiopay.in.  Include a cancelled cheque as proof of the new settlement account details. This will ensure that future settlements are credited to the correct bank account.

llm_info.heading: Updating Settlement Account Information

content: If you believe you've received a partial or incorrect settlement in your JioPay Business account, follow these steps to investigate the issue. First, log in to the JioPay Business App or Dashboard. Then, navigate to the 'Transactions' section on the App, or the 'Report Section' on the web Dashboard. Filter the transactions by the date range for which you suspect the incorrect settlement. Next, calculate the total amount for all transactions marked as 'Success'. Finally, verify if the calculated amount, after deducting transaction processing fees and taxes, matches the deposit in your linked bank account.

llm_info.heading: Investigating Partial or Incorrect Settlement

content: If the amount deposited in your linked bank account does not match the calculated amount (after deducting fees and taxes) from your successful transactions, please contact JioPay merchant support. You can reach us at merchant.support@jiopay.in. Provide details of the discrepancy, including the transaction dates, amounts, and any relevant transaction IDs to help us investigate the issue efficiently.

llm_info.heading: Contacting Support for Settlement Issues

content: To update your settlement bank account number associated with your JioPay business account, you must contact JioPay support. Please send an email to merchant.support@jiopay.in. In your email, include your registered mobile number, which is the mobile number linked to your JioPay account. Also, provide the complete details of your new bank account, including the account holder's name, bank name, branch, and account number. As proof of the new bank account details, attach a scanned copy of a cancelled cheque. The JioPay support team will then review your request and assist you with the update process. Ensure all provided information is accurate to avoid delays.

llm_info.heading: Updating Your Settlement Bank Account Number

content: As a JioPay Business merchant, you do not need to manually initiate settlement or batch closure for your account. The process of settling funds for the payments collected by you is automated. Unsettled transactions are automatically settled in your bank account based on your settlement cycle. This automated process eliminates the need for any manual intervention from your side, ensuring timely fund disbursement.

llm_info.heading: Automated Settlement Process for JioPay Business Merchants

content: JioPay may place temporary holds on settlements for certain transactions. This is a standard practice in the payment processing industry, designed to ensure the security and integrity of your transactions. Our compliance and risk teams actively monitor transactions for various risks. These holds are typically temporary, lasting for a few business days while we review your transactions. You may be contacted via your registered email or mobile number for clarifications during this review process. Once a satisfactory response is received, the funds will be released to your account according to your agreed-upon settlement frequency.

llm_info.heading: Settlement Holds: Understanding Temporary Holds on Transactions

content:
This section explains how to issue refunds to your customers using the JioPay Business App or Dashboard. To initiate a refund, follow these steps:

1.  Log in to the JioPay Business App or Dashboard.
2.  Locate the specific transaction for which you want to issue a refund.
3.  Select the transaction and click on the "Refund" option.
4.  Enter the refund amount. You can choose to issue a full or partial refund.
5.  Confirm your refund request to process it.

llm_info.heading: Issuing Refunds via JioPay Business App/Dashboard

content: To check the status of a refund in JioPay, navigate to the 'Refund' tab on your dashboard. The refund process is considered successful if the refund status displayed is either 'Accepted' or 'Success'. This indicates that the refund has been processed and the funds should be credited to the customer's account. If the status is different, please refer to the troubleshooting section or contact customer support for assistance.

llm_info.heading: Checking Refund Status in JioPay

content: To find the ARN (Acquirer Reference Number) for a refund in JioPay, you can use two methods. First, check the 'Refund History' tab on your dashboard. This provides a comprehensive list of all processed refunds, including their associated ARNs. Second, you can search for the specific transaction for which the refund was processed. Once you locate the transaction, click on it to view the details. The refund information, including the ARN, will be displayed at the bottom of the transaction details page.

llm_info.heading: Checking ARN for Refunds in JioPay

content:
If a refund initiated through JioPay is not credited to your customer's account, follow these steps to understand the process. The refund amount is handled in the following ways:

1.  **Refund Deduction:** The refund amount will be deducted from any pending settlements in your JioPay account. This means the money will be taken from funds that are already scheduled to be paid out to you.

2.  **Settlement Availability:** If there are no pending settlements available to cover the refund, the refund will be placed on hold. The refund will be processed when a new payment is received from another customer for an amount equal to or greater than the refund amount. This ensures that the refund is covered by incoming transactions.

llm_info.heading: Troubleshooting: Uncredited Refunds in Customer Accounts

content: Once a refund has been processed successfully through JioPay, it cannot be cancelled. The refunded amount is immediately transferred to the customer's account, and the transaction is considered final. Therefore, it is crucial to meticulously double-check all refund details before initiating the refund process to ensure accuracy and avoid any unintended financial consequences. This policy is in place to maintain the integrity of financial transactions and prevent potential disputes. For any questions or if you require further assistance regarding refunds or any other JioPay services, please contact merchant.support@jiopay.in.

llm_info.heading: Refund Cancellation Policy

content: JioPay's refund policy clarifies the charges associated with refunds. We do not charge any additional fees for processing refunds. However, it's important to understand that the processing charges initially levied by Jio Payments Solutions Limited (JPSL) for the original payment transaction will not be reversed or refunded. This means the merchant will bear the original processing fee even if a refund is issued to the customer. This policy ensures transparency regarding the costs involved in payment processing and refunds.

llm_info.heading: Refund Policy and Associated Charges

content: JioPay offers the functionality to perform bulk refunds for your transactions. This feature is accessible through the JioPay dashboard, providing a streamlined method for processing multiple refunds simultaneously. To initiate a bulk refund, you must upload a refund file. The file format required for upload is specified within the JioPay dashboard interface. After the file is uploaded, the system will process the refund requests. Upon completion, the system will provide a summary detailing the number of successful and failed refund records, allowing you to easily track the outcome of your bulk refund operation.

llm_info.heading: Bulk Refunds on JioPay

content:
To process a bulk refund using JioPay, follow these steps:

1.  Navigate to the refund section within the JioPay platform and click on 'Initiate Bulk Refund'. Download the provided sample file.
2.  In the downloaded file, enter your Merchant ID in the 'entity' column.
3.  Specify the 'Method type' as '211'.
4.  Input the original transaction ID in the 'original transaction ID' column.
5.  Enter the original transaction amount in the 'original transaction amount' column.
6.  Specify the refund amount to be processed in the 'amount' section.
7.  Save the file using the prescribed naming convention: `jfs_yyyymmddhhmmss_mid_recordscount`.

Ensure all steps are followed for successful refund processing.

llm_info.heading: Initiating a Bulk Refund in JioPay

content:
The file containing bulk refund details must be saved using a specific naming convention to ensure successful processing. The naming convention is as follows: `jfs_yyyymmddhhmmss_mid_recordscount`.

*   `jfs`: This is a static field and remains constant.
*   `yyyymmddhhmmss`: Represents the year, month, day, hours, minutes, and seconds of file creation.
*   `mid`: Your unique merchant ID.
*   `record count`: The total number of refund records included in the file.

Adhering to this naming convention is crucial for the system to correctly identify and process your bulk refund request.

llm_info.heading: Bulk Refund File Naming Convention

content: JioPay provides a specific format for bulk refund reports. To obtain the correct format, log in to your merchant dashboard. Navigate to the refund section and click on 'Initiate Bulk Refund'. From there, you can download a sample file that outlines the required format. It is crucial to adhere strictly to this standard format; any deviations will result in the failure of your bulk refund requests. Ensure all data fields are correctly formatted as per the sample file to avoid processing errors.

llm_info.heading: Bulk Refund Report Format and Download

content: Yes, partial refunds are permitted when processing bulk refunds through JioPay. When creating your refund file, you have the flexibility to specify a partial refund amount within the designated amount section for each transaction. This allows for granular control over refund amounts, catering to various customer service scenarios where full refunds may not be necessary or appropriate. Ensure the refund file adheres to the specified format outlined in the JioPay documentation for successful processing.

llm_info.heading: Partial Refunds in Bulk Refund Processing

content: If a bulk refund file contains records that fail to process, you can reprocess those failed records. Create a new file containing only the failed refund records, ensuring it adheres to the required format. Upload this corrected file through the JioPay dashboard. The system will process the new file separately, allowing you to retry the refund for the failed records. It's crucial to address the root cause of the initial failure to improve the chances of successful reprocessing.

llm_info.heading: Reprocessing Failed Bulk Refunds

content:
This section explains how to disable SMS notifications for specific users within the JioPay dashboard. To disable SMS notifications, follow these steps:

1.  Navigate to the 'Settings' tab and select 'User Management'.
2.  Click on the 'Action' button and choose 'Edit Permission' for the user whose notifications you want to disable.
3.  Uncheck the 'Notification Permission' checkbox.
4.  Click on 'Save Changes'.

After saving the changes, SMS notifications will be disabled for the selected user.

llm_info.heading: Disabling SMS Notifications for JioPay Users

content:
To add a new mobile number for SMS notifications within the JioPay dashboard, follow these steps:

1.  Navigate to the 'Settings' tab and select 'User Management'.
2.  Click on 'Add new users'.
3.  Enter the name and mobile number of the new user.
4.  Grant notification rights under 'Access rights'.
5.  Click on 'Add user' to finalize the process. The new mobile number will then be enabled for SMS notifications.

llm_info.heading: Adding a New Mobile Number for SMS Notifications

content: The JioPay VoiceBox is a voice audio device designed to provide instant audio confirmation for UPI payments processed through it. This portable speaker utilizes Jio SIM connectivity for operation. It's designed to offer a convenient and immediate confirmation of successful transactions. Furthermore, the VoiceBox is designed to be adaptable, with the potential to integrate add-on services tailored to specific business requirements. This allows for customization and enhanced functionality beyond basic payment confirmation.

llm_info.heading: Introduction to JioPay VoiceBox

content: The JioPay VoiceBox provides instant audio confirmation for UPI payments. Once activated, the VoiceBox automatically announces payment confirmations for transactions processed through the VoiceBox QR code. The device is specifically linked to your Merchant ID and connected to your designated bank account, ensuring seamless transaction processing and reconciliation.

llm_info.heading: JioPay VoiceBox: Functionality and Operation

content: JioPay VoiceBox offers several advantages compared to other devices. Key features include: superior battery life, exclusive entertainment content (terms and conditions apply), a premium device build, the Voicephone app for control, battery and network signal indicators, 4G high-speed network connectivity, and reliable performance in noisy outdoor environments.

llm_info.heading: JioPay VoiceBox: Key Features and Differentiators

content: To request a new JioPay VoiceBox, please send an email to merchant.support@jiopay.in. Your email should include your contact number and store address. Please note that the VoiceBox is currently available for select merchant businesses. This information is crucial for initiating the process of acquiring a VoiceBox for your business and ensuring eligibility.

llm_info.heading: Requesting a JioPay VoiceBox

content: Is doorstep installation included with the JioPay VoiceBox? Yes, doorstep installation is included with the JioPay VoiceBox. When you purchase the device, you can expect the installation process to be convenient and hassle-free. A representative or technician will come to your onboarded location and assist you in setting up the Voice speaker. This ensures that you can use the device without any difficulty or confusion. The doorstep installation service adds convenience and ensures you can enjoy a smooth and seamless setup experience for your JioPay Voicebox.

llm_info.heading: JioPay VoiceBox Doorstep Installation

content: The JioPay VoiceBox setup is an assisted process conducted by a JioPay agent. The agent initiates the setup by scanning the VoiceBox device serial number QR code and the UPI ID QR code. This is the first step in the activation process. The agent then proceeds to configure payment settings.

llm_info.heading: JioPay VoiceBox Setup: Assisted Activation Process

content: The JioPay agent inputs the merchant's personal banking UPI ID or scans the UPI QR code to set up a one-time payment and a monthly payment mandate. This configuration is crucial for processing payments through the VoiceBox. The merchant's UPI ID is essential for linking the VoiceBox to their bank account for settlements.

llm_info.heading: JioPay VoiceBox: UPI Payment Configuration

content: Following the UPI configuration, the merchant receives a notification on their UPI app to authorize the one-time payment and the monthly payment mandates. This authorization is a critical step to enable payment processing. The merchant must approve both payment types to complete the setup.

llm_info.heading: JioPay VoiceBox: Merchant Payment Authorization

content: Upon successful authorization, the one-time payment amount is debited from the merchant's UPI-linked bank account. After the one-time payment confirmation, the VoiceBox is activated and linked to the merchant's settlement bank account, enabling payment collection. This confirms the successful setup.

llm_info.heading: JioPay VoiceBox: One-Time Payment and Activation

content: To ensure the setup is complete and functioning correctly, the JioPay agent performs a test transaction. This test verifies that the VoiceBox is correctly configured and ready to process payments. This final step confirms the successful setup and activation of the VoiceBox.

llm_info.heading: JioPay VoiceBox: Setup Verification

content: The Jio VoiceBox is designed to work exclusively with its pre-activated Jio SIM. This SIM is specifically configured for the VoiceBox and cannot be used in other devices. The VoiceBox also does not support SIM cards from other mobile network operators or standard Jio SIM cards that offer voice and data services. For any connectivity issues with your VoiceBox, please contact merchant.support@jiopay.in. The support team can provide assistance and troubleshooting to resolve any connectivity problems you may experience.

llm_info.heading: VoiceBox SIM Compatibility and Support

content: If you need to return or replace your JioPay VoiceBox, please initiate the process by contacting either your dedicated JioPay executive or the merchant support team. You can reach the merchant support team at merchant.support@jiopay.in. They will provide you with detailed instructions and assistance regarding the return, replacement, or cancellation of your VoiceBox device. This includes information on the necessary steps, required documentation, and any associated fees or procedures.

llm_info.heading: VoiceBox Return/Replacement Process

content: The JioPay VoiceBox is engineered to function effectively in noisy environments. It provides clear and high-quality audio confirmation for payments, even amidst significant background noise. The device's audio output is optimized to deliver loud and audible notifications, ensuring users receive payment confirmations and alerts without issue. This feature enhances usability and reliability, allowing users to receive notifications and confirmations without inconvenience, even in crowded or noisy surroundings.

llm_info.heading: JioPay VoiceBox Noise Handling

content: To ensure optimal performance of your voice box, it's crucial to maintain it properly. The primary measure to take is to keep the voice box free of dust and dirt. Regular cleaning and maintenance will help prevent malfunctions and ensure clear communication. This simple step is essential for the longevity and reliability of your voice box.

llm_info.heading: Voice Box Maintenance: Keeping the Voice Box in Good Working Condition

content: VoiceBox announces successful UPI transactions. It will not announce failed or pending transactions. This feature provides real-time confirmation of successful payments processed through the JioPay platform, enhancing transparency and user experience for businesses. This allows merchants to quickly verify successful transactions without needing to manually check their transaction history. The focus is on providing immediate confirmation of completed transactions.

llm_info.heading: VoiceBox Transaction Announcements

content: The VoiceBox feature within JioPay supports and voices out transactions made through various UPI applications. This includes transactions initiated via MyJio, BHIM, Google Pay, PhonePe, Paytm, and other banks that are supported by the JioPay platform. This functionality allows users to receive audio confirmation of their transactions, enhancing accessibility and providing real-time transaction updates.

llm_info.heading: Supported Transaction Types for VoiceBox

content: The JioPay VoiceBox currently supports announcements in English and Hindi. We are actively working on expanding language support to include 12 additional regional languages in the near future. This expansion will provide greater accessibility and cater to a wider customer base. Please check back for updates on the availability of new languages.

llm_info.heading: Supported Languages for VoiceBox Announcements

content: To change the language of announcements within the JioPay Business app, follow these steps. The language settings can be modified directly within the application. Ensure you have the latest version of the JioPay Business app installed on your device. You can download the app from the Google Play Store by searching for 'Jiopay business'. This allows you to customize the language of the announcements to suit your preferences.

llm_info.heading: Changing Announcement Language in JioPay Business App

content: To replay the last transaction on the JioPay VoiceBox, press the function button once. This action initiates the VoiceBox to replay the details of the most recent transaction. Only transactions completed within the last 7 days can be replayed. If the last transaction occurred more than 7 days ago, pressing the function button will not provide any information.

llm_info.heading: Replaying the Last Transaction on JioPay VoiceBox

content: If your VoiceBox is not functioning correctly, the first troubleshooting step is to restart the device. This can often resolve temporary software glitches or connectivity problems. To restart, use the power buttons on the device. If the issue persists after restarting, please consult the advanced troubleshooting section or contact customer support for further assistance.

llm_info.heading: Troubleshooting VoiceBox Issues: Restarting the Device

content: If your JioPay VoiceBox is not charging, begin by verifying the power supply. Ensure the provided charger is connected to a working power outlet and that the USB connector is securely plugged into the VoiceBox. Inspect the charger and USB cable for any visible damage. Try using a different power outlet or charger to rule out power source issues. If the VoiceBox still fails to charge after these checks, please contact merchant.support@jiopay.in for further technical assistance.

llm_info.heading: Troubleshooting VoiceBox Charging Issues

content:
To power on your JioPay VoiceBox and verify its operational status, follow these steps:

1. Locate the power button on your VoiceBox.
2. Press and hold the power button for a few seconds.
3. Release the power button once you see or hear indications of the device powering on.

llm_info.heading: Powering On and Verifying JioPay VoiceBox Operation

content: If your device is not turning on, the first step is to connect it to a charger. Allow the device to charge for 10-15 minutes. This can help determine if the issue is related to a depleted battery. If the device still doesn't turn on after charging, further troubleshooting steps may be required. Please refer to the device's user manual or contact customer support for assistance.

llm_info.heading: Device Not Turning On: Troubleshooting

content: If your device is not connecting to the network, the first troubleshooting step is to restart the device. This can typically be done by using the power buttons on your device. This simple action often resolves temporary network glitches and allows the device to re-establish a connection. If the issue persists after restarting, further troubleshooting steps may be required, such as checking your network settings or contacting your network provider.

llm_info.heading: Troubleshooting Network Connectivity Issues

content: The VoiceBox service from JioPay incurs two primary charges: a one-time setup fee and a recurring monthly subscription fee. The setup fee is payable during the installation or activation of the VoiceBox. The monthly subscription fee covers the ongoing services provided by the VoiceBox and will be automatically debited from your designated account. Please ensure sufficient funds are available to avoid service interruption.

llm_info.heading: VoiceBox Charges: Setup and Subscription Fees

content: To obtain an invoice for a payment made towards your VoiceBox subscription, please use the JioPay Business app. The invoice is directly accessible within the app, providing a convenient way to manage your payment records. This allows you to easily track and reconcile your subscription payments. For any issues accessing the invoice, please refer to the troubleshooting section or contact customer support.

llm_info.heading: Obtaining Payment Invoices for VoiceBox Subscriptions

content: To control the volume of the JioPay VoiceBox, please refer to the device's physical controls. Ensure the VoiceBox is powered on by checking the power indicator LED. If the LED is illuminated, the device is receiving power. Further instructions on volume adjustment can be found in the VoiceBox user manual or on the JioPay support website. This information is crucial for ensuring clear audio during transactions and customer interactions.

llm_info.heading: Controlling JioPay VoiceBox Volume

content: To check the battery level of your JioPay VoiceBox, observe the power indicator LED. If the VoiceBox is powered on, the LED will provide an indication of the battery status. The specific color or pattern of the LED (e.g., solid green, flashing red) will indicate the battery level. Refer to the VoiceBox user manual for detailed information on LED color codes and their corresponding battery level interpretations. This allows you to quickly assess the remaining battery life and take necessary action, such as charging the device, to ensure uninterrupted service.

llm_info.heading: Checking JioPay VoiceBox Battery Level

content: The power LED on your JioPay device provides visual cues about the battery status. When the device is charging, the LED will display a RED light. This allows you to quickly assess the charging status of your device. Further information regarding other LED indications and troubleshooting steps can be found in the device manual or by contacting JioPay customer support.

llm_info.heading: Understanding JioPay Device Battery Status via LED Indicators

content: Upon receiving the JioPay DQR standee, the store manager is responsible for several onboarding steps. First, they must perform a Goods Received Note (GRN) entry. Following this, the manager should watch the provided DIY video for device installation guidance. It's crucial to match each device to the corresponding billing system; ensure one device per billing system. Any discrepancies must be reported to the RRL support team and the cluster managers. Finally, connect the device to the USB port of the billing system, as demonstrated in the video, and perform the 'Sign out' and 'Sign in' actions within the billing system or RPoS application. This process must be repeated for each billing system or RPoS application present in the store.

llm_info.heading: JioPay DQR Standee: Store Manager Onboarding and Device Setup

content: The local State Digital DC will dispatch the devices. The store manager will receive the JioPay DQR from the local State Digital DC. This process ensures secure and efficient delivery of necessary hardware for JioPay integration. Please contact your local State Digital DC for any delivery-related inquiries or issues. This is a critical step in setting up your JioPay system.

llm_info.heading: JioPay Device Dispatch and Delivery

content: If a neighborhood Smart Point has JioPay functionality, but a specific store manager is unable to access it, the store manager should contact the RRL team for assistance. This is done by emailing merchant.support@jiopay.in. This email address is managed by the RCP team and is the designated channel for resolving Smart Point availability issues. Ensure the email clearly states the issue and the specific Smart Point in question for faster resolution.

llm_info.heading: Contacting Support for Smart Point Availability Issues

content: If a DQR (Digital Quick Response) device is defective, the store manager must initiate a support request. The recommended action is to contact the RRL support team directly. Alternatively, the store manager can send an email to merchant support at merchant.support@jiopay.in. When reporting a defective DQR device via email, the store manager is required to provide specific details to facilitate a prompt resolution. This ensures efficient troubleshooting and replacement if necessary.

llm_info.heading: Defective DQR Device: Reporting and Replacement

content: When emailing merchant support (merchant.support@jiopay.in) regarding a defective DQR device, the store manager must include specific details to expedite the resolution process. This information is crucial for the support team to understand the issue and initiate the appropriate actions, such as device replacement or troubleshooting steps. The exact details to be included should be specified in the email or provided by the RRL support team when contacted directly.

llm_info.heading: Information Required for Defective DQR Device Email

content: If the store manager receives an incorrect number of JioPay devices (either excess or fewer than expected), they must report this discrepancy to the RRL Support team. This is crucial for ensuring accurate device allocation and preventing operational issues. The store manager should immediately contact RRL Support to rectify the situation. The RRL Support team will then coordinate the return of excess devices or the delivery of additional devices as needed. The store manager must include specific email addresses and detailed information when reporting the discrepancy to facilitate a prompt resolution.

llm_info.heading: Device Quantity Discrepancy Reporting

content: To begin using the DQR device for transactions, follow these steps: 1. Connect the USB port of the DQR device to the USB port of the RPoS Billing system. This is a plug-and-play setup. 2. On the device screen, perform a 'signout' followed by a 'sign in'. 3. Conduct a Re1 test transaction. At checkout, select the 'JioPay UPI DQR' option as the Mode of Payment (MOP). 4. The DQR code will instantly generate on the DQR Device. The customer can then scan and pay using any UPI/BHIM application. For assistance, contact the RRL Support team or email merchant.support@jiopay.in.

llm_info.heading: DQR Device Onboarding and Transaction Process

content: If you encounter any issues while using the DQR device, the store manager should contact the RRL Support team for assistance. Alternatively, you can send an email detailing the problem to merchant.support@jiopay.in. Please include relevant details about the issue, such as error messages, transaction details, and the steps taken before the problem occurred. This information will help the support team diagnose and resolve the issue efficiently.

llm_info.heading: DQR Device Troubleshooting and Support Contact

content: JioPay DQR (Dynamic QR) supports payments from a wide range of UPI applications. Customers can initiate payments using any UPI application, including but not limited to MyJio, PhonePe, GPay (Google Pay), and Paytm. This allows for flexibility and convenience for your customers when making payments through JioPay DQR.

llm_info.heading: Supported UPI Payment Applications for JioPay DQR

content: If UPI payments are failing due to internet connectivity or network issues, the store manager should contact the RRL Enterprise IT team for assistance. The designated email address for reporting these issues is Retailit@ril.com. This is the primary channel for resolving technical problems affecting UPI payment processing within the JioPay system. Ensure to provide detailed information about the issue, including the time of the failure and any error messages received.

llm_info.heading: Troubleshooting UPI Payment Failures Due to Network Issues

content: If the Dynamic Quick Response (DQR) functionality is not working correctly after connecting to the Retail Point of Sale (RPoS) Billing System, the store manager should contact the JioPay merchant support team for assistance. The support team can be reached at merchant.support@jiopay.in. When reporting the issue, the store manager must provide specific details to help the support team diagnose and resolve the problem effectively. This ensures a swift resolution and minimizes any disruption to payment processing.

llm_info.heading: Troubleshooting DQR Issues with RPoS Billing System

content: To initiate a refund for a normal DQR (Dynamic QR) transaction, the store manager must create a call log containing the transaction details. This call log should include the RRN (Retrieval Reference Number), the transaction amount, the transaction date, and the Mode of Payment (MOP), which should be specified as JioPay UPI DQR. The call log, along with the transaction details, must be submitted to the central refund team at ARR.Refund@ril.com.

llm_info.heading: Initiating Refunds for JioPay DQR Transactions

content: The refund process for JioPay transactions follows the existing refund procedures. All refund requests are processed by the central refund team, accessible via email at ARR.Refund@ril.com. This team handles all aspects of the refund process, ensuring accuracy and adherence to established protocols.

llm_info.heading: Refund Process for JioPay Transactions

content: In situations where a customer has been credited an excess amount, the refund team will process the necessary adjustments. Following the initiation of the refund by the team, the customer can expect to receive the credit within T+2 days. This timeframe accounts for the processing and settlement procedures involved in reversing the excess credit.

llm_info.heading: Timeline for Refunds in Case of Excess Credit

content: Training on the usage of DQR (likely a JioPay feature or system) is provided as a one-time activity. This training will be communicated to users by their cluster heads or RRL support. For any feature additions or updates to the DQR product, users will be informed through self-help (DIY) videos or store communications provided by the RRL Support team.

llm_info.heading: DQR Usage Training and Support

content: If a transaction times out, merchants should first check the transaction status. The store interface provides a 'Check Status' option to determine if the payment was successful. If the status remains unconfirmed after the timeout, the merchant should cancel the original order and create a new one. The customer will then need to re-initiate the payment. Any previous payment made by the customer will be refunded.

llm_info.heading: Handling Transaction Timeouts: Checking Payment Status

content: This section explains the settlement process for payments made by customers via DQR (Digital QR code) using JioPay. The settlement of funds to the Reliance Retail Limited (RRL) settlement account occurs on a T+1 day basis. This means that if a payment is made today (T), the settlement will be completed on the following day (T+1). This process ensures timely transfer of funds to the merchant's designated account.

llm_info.heading: Settlement Process for DQR Payments

content:
The 'Cancel' option within the JioPay payment status check is designed for specific scenarios where a payment initiated by the cashier has not been completed by the customer. This option allows for adjustments or corrections before the payment is finalized. The following situations warrant the use of the 'Cancel' option:

*   The customer wishes to add more products to their order.
*   The customer has not yet initiated the payment process.
*   The customer wants to change the method of payment (MOP).
*   The payment failed on the customer's end, and they wish to change the MOP.

llm_info.heading: Using the 'Cancel' Option in JioPay Payment Status Checks

content:
This section outlines scenarios where the 'Cancel' option should *not* be used when dealing with JioPay transactions. It's crucial to understand these situations to avoid disrupting payment processing and ensure accurate transaction records. Specifically, the 'Cancel' option should be avoided in the following situations:

*   **Pending Payments:** When a payment has been initiated but is pending due to network issues or other problems. In this case, wait for the transaction to either fail or succeed on the customer's end.
*   **Customer Confirmation Required:** Always confirm the transaction status with the customer before using the 'Cancel' option.
*   **Confirmation Timeout:** If the customer's payment is successful, but confirmation is not received by the Retail Point of Sale (RPOS) system, wait for a 2-minute timeout before considering other actions.

llm_info.heading: When to Avoid Using the 'Cancel' Option for Payments

content: The JioPay Business Partner Program is designed to be a rewarding B2B program in India. Becoming a JioPay Business partner offers the opportunity to earn commissions and provide a convenient digital payments experience for your customers. This program is designed to benefit businesses by offering a robust payment solution and a chance to increase revenue through commissions. The program emphasizes ease of use and customer satisfaction, making it a valuable offering for businesses looking to enhance their payment infrastructure.

llm_info.heading: Introduction to the JioPay Business Partner Program

content: The JioPay Business Partner Program offers a recurring payment structure. Partners earn based on the volume of transactions processed through JioPay Business. The specific percentage or amount earned per transaction is not detailed in this document. For detailed information on the exact earning structure, including commission rates and payment schedules, please refer to the full Business Partner Program documentation or contact JioPay support directly.

llm_info.heading: JioPay Business Partner Program: Earning Structure

content: Businesses already registered with JioPay Business are eligible to sign up as partners. This allows existing JioPay Business users to expand their engagement with JioPay by participating in the partner program. This means that if a business is already using JioPay for payment processing or other services, they can also become a JioPay partner. This opens up opportunities for additional benefits and collaborations within the JioPay ecosystem. Further details on the partner program, including benefits and enrollment procedures, can be found on the JioPay Business website or by contacting JioPay support.

llm_info.heading: JioPay Business Partner Enrollment for Existing Businesses

content: P2PM Merchants are merchants onboarded with JioPay using minimal KYC details, specifically Proof of Identification and Address, but without Proof of Business (PoB). To onboard as a P2PM merchant, you need to provide your Aadhar card or Driving License, and your bank account details, which will be verified via a penny drop. These merchants have specific transaction limits.

llm_info.heading: Understanding P2PM Merchants on JioPay

content: P2PM merchants have a monthly cumulative Inward UPI Transaction limit of ₹ 1,00,000/-. The daily transaction limit is ₹ 25,000/-, and the per-transaction limit is ₹ 10,000/-. These limits are set by NPCI and are subject to change based on their instructions. Transactions exceeding these limits will be declined, and neither the customer nor the merchant will be debited or credited.

llm_info.heading: P2PM Merchant Transaction Limits

content: P2PM merchants can request an upgrade to a P2M merchant account. If a P2PM merchant exceeds the ₹ 1,00,000/- monthly transaction limit for three consecutive months, JioPay will mandatorily upgrade them to P2M. This upgrade is contingent upon the merchant providing the necessary documentation required for P2M-specific KYC.

llm_info.heading: Upgrading from P2PM to P2M Merchant

content: P2PM (Person-to-Person Merchant) merchants on JioPay are subject to specific transaction limits. The monthly cumulative Inward UPI Transaction limit for accepting payments is ₹ 1,00,000/-. The daily limit is ₹ 25,000/-, and the per-transaction limit is ₹ 10,000/-. These limits are set by NPCI (National Payments Corporation of India) and are subject to change based on their instructions. Transactions exceeding these limits will not be processed by JioPay and will be declined. In such cases, neither the customer will be debited, nor the merchant credited.

llm_info.heading: P2PM Merchant Transaction Limits

content: Becoming a JioPay P2M (Person-to-Merchant) merchant offers several advantages. Primarily, P2M merchants gain the ability to accept payments with higher transaction value limits. These limits are adjustable and are determined based on the Merchant Category Code (MCC) and the risk rules applicable to the specific merchant account. This flexibility allows businesses to process larger transactions efficiently and securely. This feature is particularly beneficial for businesses with higher average transaction values or those dealing with high-value goods and services.

llm_info.heading: Benefits of Becoming a JioPay P2M Merchant

content: After submitting an upgradation request to become a P2M (Person-to-Merchant) merchant, the processing time typically ranges from 24 to 48 hours. This timeframe is contingent upon the successful fulfillment and validation of all submitted documents. Merchants will receive an alert notification once their KYC (Know Your Customer) upgradation is successfully completed.

llm_info.heading: P2M Merchant Upgradation Processing Time

content: P2PM merchants on JioPay have a monthly cumulative Inward UPI Transaction limit of ₹ 1,00,000/-. Transactions exceeding this limit will not be processed and will be declined. Merchants exceeding this limit cannot accept payments until the next month or until they upgrade to a P2M KYC Merchant account. If the ₹ 1,00,000/- monthly limit is breached for three consecutive months, JioPay will require the merchant to upgrade to a P2M KYC Merchant account, as per NPCI guidelines. Further transactions may be blocked until the upgrade is complete.

llm_info.heading: P2PM Merchant Monthly Transaction Limit and Consequences

content:
This section outlines the procedures for changing your JioPay settlement account. You can update your settlement account through two methods:

i. **Via Chatbot:** Navigate to the 'Account management menu' within the JioPay chatbot. Select 'More about Account management,' then 'Modify Settlement account.' Initiate a request to update your account details, selecting your Merchant ID (MID). Attach a picture of your passbook or a cancelled check, and submit the request. You can track the ticket status in the 'Ticket Status' section of the chatbot.

ii. **Via Email:** Send an email to merchant.support@jiopay.in. Include your MID, bank account number, IFSC code, and a picture of your passbook or a cancelled check. The subject line of the email should be 'Settlement Account Change Request for MID: <Enter MID>'.

llm_info.heading: Changing Your JioPay Settlement Account
